answerText: viscosity [accept word forms][10] The viscosity of a shear thickening fluid increases with an increase in this value, which has units of force per unit area. The Cauchy tensor represents this quantity.
heading: MUT |2012 | 1 | 7 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Stokes' law describes the motion of a sphere through a fluid as a function of this property of the fluid.  [10] Name this property which, for a Newtonian fluid, is always constant. This value describes a fluid's resistance to flow, and is zero for superfluids.
